result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Not possess or consume alcohol or other controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Not associate with persons possessing or consuming controlled substances. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.

ACS Groups/Day report at a level determined by the case manager. 
Obtain a mental health assessment and comply with treatment recommendations. 
Obtain an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
Sign releases for treatment providers. 
Participate in other community based services as determined as appropriate by the VIP Program Director.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek D Brock

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: /s/ RJS 10/18/16 - Dismissed without Prejudice **Reason:  Mr Brock successfully completed the VIP Program as indicated in an attached letter dated October 17, 2016 from VIP Program Director, Mike Champion

Defendant Derek D Brock in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
2:07 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to WITHHOLD entry of Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Court orders the VIP program. 
Court incorporates the conditions on the recommendation form into the Order.

P/NG entered.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.

2:34 p.m. Defendant Derek D Brock not in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter rescheduled.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Maintain absolute sobriety  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  C.L.  Not be on premises of Partners Pub.

ADA  Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:16 PM Court calls case.

ADA Constable  states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct, Resisting/Obstructing an Officer, and Battery.
Court informs Defendant of right to remain silent.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Court questions Defendant.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: April 20, 2015   @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
